name: treatment of bottom ash, MSWI, scrap copper, slag compartment | bottom ash, MSWI, scrap copper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28269/documentation

The process represents the treatment of controlled landfilling in slag compartment of a waste (bottom ash) that is exclusively generated in another waste treatment. Bottom ash is the by-product that is generated during the municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI) of 'scrap copper'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'scrap copper'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the slag compartment landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to surface water and long-term emissions to ground water).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters affecting the treatment technology are not specific to this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Slag compartment for bottom ash from incineration with base seal and leachate collection system (Landfill type D). Recultivation after closure.

exchanges.description: main reference product of this activity (supply of disposal service).

exchanges.description: Inventory indicator for waste mass disposed. To be used in EN15804 "other data" results.

Mass of waste initially put in a slag compartment. The exchange represents a flow that is within the technosphere. This exchange should only be used to apply ecofactors for the Swiss LCIA method of Ecological Scarcity and not any other purpose.
